content.text: (a) (i) He makes a tally of the number of ice creams he sells on Friday.
Work out the number of ice creams he sells on Friday.
(ii) 15 of the ice creams he sells on Friday are vanilla.
Work out the fraction of ice creams he sells on Friday that are vanilla.
Give your answer in its simplest form.
(iii) He buys tubs of ice cream for his shop in the ratio vanilla : chocolate \(= 11:7\).
He buys 28 tubs of chocolate ice cream.
Work out how many tubs of vanilla ice cream he buys.
(i) Work out the range.
(ii) Find the median.
(iii) Calculate the mean.
(b) Antonio records the number of chairs his shop hires out on each day for a week.
(c) (i) Antonio buys beach balls for \(\$ 2.50\) each and sells them for \(\$ 4.20\) each.
Work out the percentage profit he makes on each beach ball.
(ii) A beach ball is a sphere with radius 15 cm .
Calculate the volume of the beach ball. Give the units of your answer.
[The volume, \(V\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}\).]
(d) The shop sells sun cream in bottles \(A, B\) and \(C\).
Work out which bottle is the best value. You must show all your working.
1 Antonio has a shop near the beach.
2 (a) (i) Complete the table of values for \(y=-\frac{6}{x}\).
(ii) On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=\frac{-6}{x}\) for \(-6 \leqslant x \leqslant-1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\).
(iii) Write down the order of rotational symmetry of the graph.
(iv) Write down the equation of each line of symmetry of the graph. and
(v) On the grid, draw the line \(y=2.5\).
(vii) Use your graph to solve the equation \(\frac{-6}{x}=2.5\).
Draw a line that passes through the point \(P\) and is perpendicular to line \(L\).
(i) Write down the mathematical name for the type of angle \(a\).
(ii) Measure angle \(a\).
(i) Draw a sketch of this quadrilateral.
(ii) Write down the mathematical name for this quadrilateral.
(iii) One of the interior angles of this quadrilateral is \(70^{\circ}\).
Work out the other three interior angles.
(b) Kate describes a quadrilateral.

- All the sides are the same length.
- It has only two lines of symmetry.
(i) The triangle is used to write down an equation in terms of \(x\) and \(y\).
Give the geometrical reason why this equation is correct.
Reason
(ii) Use the diagram with two angles on a straight line to write down another equation in terms of \(x\) and \(y\).
(iii) Solve these simultaneous equations. You must show all your working.
(c) The diagrams show the angles in a triangle and two angles on a straight line.
(i) Work out the area of the shaded rectangle, \(A\).
(ii) The volume of the cuboid is \(468 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\).
Complete the statement.
The dimensions of the cuboid are cm by cm by cm
4 (a) The diagram shows the net of a cuboid.
(b) A cylinder has a radius of 8 cm and a height of 12 cm .
Calculate, in terms of \(\pi\), the volume of the cylinder.
The diagram shows a circle with a diameter of 7 cm and a parallelogram with a base of 12 cm . The circle touches two of the sides of the parallelogram.
Calculate the shaded area.
(a) Complete the scatter diagram.
The first eight points have been plotted for you.
(b) What type of correlation is shown in the scatter diagram?
(c) On the scatter diagram, put a ring around the point for the journey that has the highest price per kilometre travelled.
(d) On the scatter diagram, draw a line of best fit.
(e) The scale drawing shows two airports, \(K\) and \(L\). The scale is 1 centimetre represents 50 kilometres.
Scale: 1 cm to 50 km
A plane flies in a straight line from \(K\) to \(L\).
Use the scale drawing and your line of best fit to find an estimate for the ticket price of the journey from \(K\) to \(L\).
5 Rebecca records the flight distance and the ticket price for each of her last 12 plane journeys.
(i) Write down the distance Mr Vay travels in the first 8 minutes.
(ii) Explain what is happening between 0708 and 0712.
(iii) Between which times is Mr Vay's journey the fastest? Give a reason for your answer.
Between and
(iv) Work out Mr Vay's average speed for the whole journey. Give your answer in kilometres per hour.
(a) The travel graph shows Mr Vay's journey from his home to the bank.
(b) Katya takes some coins to the bank.
The table shows the number of each type of coin.

table.html:
Type of coinNumber of coins
1 cent12
5 cent23
10 cent17
25 cent9
50 cent7
1 dollar24

content.text: Work out the total amount of money Katya takes to the bank.
Give your answer in dollars.
(c) Adam changes \(\$ 700\) into euros at the bank.
The exchange rate is \(\$ 1=0.904\) euros.
Work out the amount Adam receives.
(d) Clara invests \(\$ 8500\) for 4 years at a rate of \(1.7 \%\) per year simple interest.
Calculate the total interest earned during the 4 years.
6 Mr Vay works in a bank.
Shade some squares so that both shapes have the same fraction shaded.
(i) Draw the next two shapes in this pattern.
(ii) What do the position numbers of the shape \(\square\) have in common?
(iii) Pierre says that the shape in position number 99 is a \(\square\).
Explain why he is correct.
(b) Here is a pattern.
Position number 1 is a .
Position number 2 is a
